title: Upsilon Draconis
text:
Upsilon Draconis (υ Dra) is a <a href="binary%20star">binary star</a> system in the northern <a href="circumpolar%20constellation">circumpolar constellation</a> of <a href="Draco%20%28constellation%29">Draco</a>. It is faintly visible to the naked eye with an <a href="apparent%20visual%20magnitude">apparent visual magnitude</a> of 4.83. Based upon an annual <a href="stellar%20parallax">parallax shift</a> of 9.48 <a href="milliarcsecond">mas</a> as measured from Earth, it is located around 340 <a href="light%20year">light year</a>s from the <a href="Sun">Sun</a>. At that distance, the visual magnitude of the star is diminished by an <a href="extinction%20%28astronomy%29">extinction factor</a> of 0.02 due to <a href="interstellar%20dust">interstellar dust</a>.
In <a href="Chinese%20astronomy">Chinese</a>, (), meaning "<a href="Purple%20Forbidden%20enclosure">Left Wall of Purple Forbidden Enclosure</a>", refers to an asterism consisting of υ Draconis, <a href="Iota%20Draconis">ι Draconis</a>, <a href="Eta%20Draconis">η Draconis</a>, <a href="Zeta%20Draconis">ζ Draconis</a>, <a href="Theta%20Draconis">θ Draconis</a>, <a href="73%20Draconis">73 Draconis</a>, <a href="Gamma%20Cephei">γ Cephei</a> and <a href="23%20Cassiopeiae">23 Cassiopeiae</a>.
This is a single-lined <a href="spectroscopic%20binary">spectroscopic binary</a> star system with an <a href="orbital%20period">orbital period</a> of 258.48 days and an <a href="orbital%20eccentricity">eccentricity</a> of 0.21. The primary, component A, is an <a href="stellar%20evolution">evolved</a> <a href="K-type%20star">K-type</a> <a href="giant%20star">giant star</a> with a <a href="stellar%20classification">stellar classification</a> of K0 III. It is a suspected <a href="barium%20star">barium star</a>, which may indicate the orbiting companion, component B, is a <a href="white%20dwarf">white dwarf</a> star.
The measured <a href="angular%20diameter">angular diameter</a> of the primary, after correction for <a href="limb%20darkening">limb darkening</a>, is . At the estimated distance of Upsilon Draconis, this yields a physical size of about 19 times the <a href="Sun%27s%20radius">Sun's radius</a>. It is about 1.37 billion years old with an estimated 2.05 times the <a href="mass%20of%20the%20Sun">mass of the Sun</a>. The star is radiating 2.23 times the <a href="solar%20luminosity">solar luminosity</a> from its <a href="photosphere">photosphere</a> at an <a href="effective%20temperature">effective temperature</a> of 4,561 K.
References.
\end{align}</math></ref>
